awd_titl_txt: A Meeting of the PIs of the NSF REU Sites in Astronomy
awd_abstract_narration:
REU Sites are NSF funded projects that provide research experiences for undergraduate students. The directors of the REU Sites that are funded primarily out of astronomy will get together for a meeting to discuss best practices and lessons learned for recruitment of students from smaller institutions and broadening participation from a diverse population of students. This proposal will support this meeting, to be held in Alexandria Virginia.

The REU Site directors meeting will be held in conjunction with the Council on Undergraduate Research that will be held October 29, 2018. The meeting will address issues of common concern among astronomy REU Site directors. Some of the main topics will include recruitment from lesser-known universities and small colleges, enhancing the participation and recruitment of female and under-represented minority students, and establishing connections with local programs.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The main purpose of this award was to provide financail support for the directors of the NSF AST REU sites to attend a bi-annual meeting of the site directors. We organized meetings in 2018, 2020, and 2022.

 

There are two main outcomes associated with this award.

1) The meetings resulted in the development of a uniform recruiting procedure and a uniform application deadline among all AST REU sites. It also eliminated internal competition among the sites.

2) In 2022, we organized our meeting in collaboration with NPRLG, the NSF Physics REU Leadership Group.  NPRLG is a consortium of all REU site directors whose programs are funded by NSF Physics. They work in coordination with the American Physical Society (APS) as well as with NSF. They hold an annual meeting that is a great occasion for networking and seminars about how to improve our programs. The major outcome of combining our 2022 meeting with NPRLG was that they agreed to allow NSF AST REU sites to become members of their consortium. That will allow the AST REU site directors to attend the NPRLG annual meeting where they can benefit from their training workshops and programs. This joining will also enhance the diversity in recruitment by the astronomy sites, and enhances their abilities to recruit students from underprivileged schools and areas.
